name: Katherine Webb
religion: Katherine Webb is a devout Christian.
author: Caitlin Frye

content.text: Katherine Webb was born in Montgomery, Alabama and grew up in Phenix City, Alabama just outside Columbus, Georgia.

Webb is a devout Christian, although I couldn't place which denomination. Regardless, she is completely dedicated to the teachings of Jesus and living the Christian life. Before her big , Webb spoke to a local newspaper about her life goals after being crowed Miss Alabama USA. She said,

content.sourceTitle: 5 Questions with Katherine Webb: Miss Alabama USA seeks to set an example.
content.text: The best part about [being Miss Alabama USA] is that I will be able to show who I really am and just love and care for everyone just like Jesus does. At the end of the day I am just a girl from Phenix City, Ala., with a crown and a sash, but through Christ, I am a representative for him and what being a Christian really means.

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Webb's dad: "Give Brent a break."
content.text: In numerous interviews since their daughter gained national celebrity status, Webb's parents have expounded on their daughter's faith, saying she was devout from a young age.

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Webb, Miss Alabama used to be bullied cause she was 'ugly.' Now offered to appear in Playboy.
content.text: Her father claimed it was Webb's devotion to Christianity that carried her through her struggle with , a disease that causes depigmentation of the skin.

If you want a more personal window into Webb's religious outlook, you could always check out her  page, where her bio is "Miss AL USA 2012. Matthew 5:16." You'll find plenty of inspirational Christian retweets there. In the meantime, if you can help us out with a denomination, let us know in the comments. Thanks, readers.

content.sourceTitle: Feminist Blogger Thinks Katherine Webb's Beauty Perpetuates "Rape Culture."
content.text: The only information I could find in any search on Katherine Webb's political beliefs had to do with how many calories she eats in a day or whether or not she should have been offended when an ESPN announcer talked for a little bit too long about how attractive she is. And speaking of that last point, she did get the blogosphere heated up about whether or not that incident was offensive to women.

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Webb on Musburger's remarks, ESPN apology, Dockett's tweet.
content.text: As far as Webb herself, she didn't take offense.
In fact, it got her a few high profile gigs, like a modeling job for the  Swimsuit Issue, so I'm sure she's not too bummed.
When it comes to partisan politics, however, she's as silent as a church mouse. Alabama is consistently a red state,
so one could assume she's a Republican. But it would all be assumptions. I think it's safer to assume she's as non-political as they come.
